- In the IN statement structure, if an Expr exists, the "visit()" method is executed directly.

Please help me to confirm whether there is any problem to change the code in this way?

title: Federated SQL query and Query optimization
body:
Fixes #8284.

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- add calcite as optimization framework for sql optimization, `org.apache.shardingsphere.infra.optimize.planner.Compiler` is the entrance of sql optimization.
- add optimization rules based on calcite heuristic and volcano optimization planner, theses rule files are packaged in `org.apache.shardingsphere.infra.optimize.planner.rule` , `shardingsphere-infra-optimize` module.
- add a volcano executor framework and some implementation classes to execute the physical plan, which is in `shardingsphere-infra-executor` module. 
- add an evaluator framework for the execution of expressions and functions in distribution sql layer, this is just in the beginning phase.
- other changes include SQL AST converter, meta data converter and so on.

title: Fixed the bug that the order of multiple sharding keys in the Hint strategy
body: In the Hint strategy, since HintManager uses HashMultimap to store the sharding keys, the order of the multiple sharding keys obtained by the sharding algorithm may be inconsistent with expectations.

title: In a transaction, force any sql to be executed on the Master (v4.x)
body:
Fixes #8215 

Changes proposed in this pull request:
- In a transaction, force any sql to be executed on the Master

I recently ran into a problem with shardingsphere-proxy (v4.1.1), where I was using the same transaction, inserting first, and then querying but not getting results.

**SQL:**

```sql
1.drop   TABLE
2.create TABLE

3.set autoCommit = false

4.insert into TABLE

5.select * from TABLE (  No data ...)

6.commit
```
